channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: They Turned 18 and Immediately Had a Credit Score Over 700
item.description: Giving a child a credit card can give them a big credit boost. When it doesn’t work, they risk inheriting mistakes.

item.title: ‘I feel slighted’: My husband and I are in our 70s. We married 3 years ago. He’s leaving his $1.8 million home to a 10-year-old relative. Is that normal?
item.description: ‘I have almost double his pension income, as his former wives took a considerable share’

item.title: Oil-Field Service Companies Ask: Where Did All the Wildcatters Go?
item.description: Drilling activity is weak in the U.S., but oil-field service companies’ margins remain strong.

item.title: Investing in real estate isn’t all it’s cracked up to be
item.description: This asset class went 68 years with no net gain

item.title: The Trump Trade Is Back. But Did It Ever Work?
item.description: Investors are buying small-cap and “old economy” stocks in a way reminiscent of 2016. It won’t necessarily pan out.

item.title: How to know if a financial planner is a good match or a mismatch for your money
item.description: Get the lowdown on a financial adviser before you give them a dime.

item.title: The Score: Goldman Sachs, Trump Media, CrowdStrike and More Stocks That Defined the Week
item.description: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week’s news.

item.title: CrowdStrike outage affected 8.5 million Windows devices, Microsoft says
item.description: Microsoft said Saturday it estimates that worldwide about 8.5 million computers were disabled by the outage caused by an update from the Texas based c...

item.title: Stocks Drop During Tech Outage at End of Volatile Week
item.description: The Dow industrials and Nasdaq fell after a global technology outage knocked out operations for a range of companies and forced airlines to ground fli...

item.title: I don’t need the money from my IRA right now — should I do a Roth conversion to avoid RMDs?
item.description: A pension, Social Security and military retirement pay cover our expenses
